title: low priority queue
body: so once in a while if i d/c or have to leave the game urgently i get chuck into low priority. this is not fair, i do not deserve to wait 10 minutes-20 minutes for  5 games in a row, this makes me not even want to play at all. i could understand if it was for ranked, if i was to join a ranked game i would have definitely set aside a hole few hours so that i can play without interuption. also another thing is if both team wont end a game, such as when a team is so overly fed and they wonna keep killing us and then theres 2 people on the team who just dont wonna surrender, how is it fair if i have to sit there and play a dead game for an hour just so i dont get put in low priority queue.

replies.body:
I hear you that things can come up sometimes. Unfortunately when you leave a game, whether it's for a good reason or not it impacts the other players in the game.

Both your team and the other team are suddenly in a game that's not as good. When you queue up it's you saying 'hey i'm going to commit to playing this game to the end'. This applies whether it's a normal or ranked game.

It's the same with disconnects. I suffer from them at times at home and it's frustrating as hell, but it's even more frustrating for the other players in the game. 

My internet issues are not their fault, and I could argue that it's not my fault because my internet provider or the phone line or something else is messing up, but realistically when i say 'Hey i'm going to commit to playing this game to the end' that also means how I connect to the internet.

Again, I totally understand the frustration, because sometimes you just have to go, but for the most part this won't happen that often and you are making it a bad experience for the other players in a game when you leave.

What happens if like the internet provider fucks up?

There's no justice there.

And usually we can't prove that they did fuck up *cough* tpg *cough*.

Such a scenario doesn't occur often enough to cause you to get hi with the Leaver Buster.

I had two DCs in one game the other week, but because it was one game out of the hundreds I play Leaver Buster ignores me.

You have to leave a significant portion of your games in order to get hit with low priority.

well then ill say this, can anyone actually join a game and promise that they will not possibly have to leave or be disconnected, if you think you can then you are lying. i understand fully that yes it ruins games, i hate it too, but the low priority queue is unjustified and unfair, 5 game of waiting 20 minutes per game is ridiculous, might aswell not play at all if im gonna d/c once a week then have to wait 20 minutes per game.

It cannot be fully guaranteed but it can be known that you leaving/dcing/whatever is virtually impossible. Besides that, LeaverBuster is based off of percentage of games, so unless you rarely play, you're not going to get punished. On different accounts I've been suspended/gotten low priority for leaving two games in one week and on others I've had to leave more than 5 in a short time before I was punished.

in over 1500 games theres been like 2 cases where ive had to step away for more than a minute. cases where ive had to fully abandon the game is on the 1st day of playing where i didnt know any better or realise how serious it was to do so, and then like 3-4 other times was unexpected problems from my ISP

im in control of everything i do. so are you. if you arent, dont play. if you have kids you have to pick up from school in the next hour, dont play. if you have any other responsibilities you have to do in an hour, dont play. if you're expecting a call, expecting a guest, expecting a baby, dont play. if you have numerous uncontrollable variables in your life, dont play. if your internet is crap, dont force other people to play with you. if you're not gonna play properly you may aswell be treated as a toxic feeder, because thats what you are, in value, to your teammates

but you do have a good point. to me whats worse than a toxic feeder are people that dont surrender when its so obvious the enemies are just toying with us. both sides of this sort of game is just as cancerous and something needs to be done there because i dont even think riot are aware of this problem because its definitely not as obvious as just regular toxicity and stuff

TL;DR

You're ruining the experiences of everyone you play with and as such have been punished. You should not join a game unless you are certain you can and will play the game until the end.

The riot framework slash system as a whole is pretty sub par for an annual billion dollar company.  Using an extreme example:  you get an afk warning 5 times in a row for sitting in fountain because your team has agreed to give up (you have an intentional feeder ect). You will be punished and reported quicker than the intentional feeder. Secondly, low priority queue is built in for people with high hidden rating unintentionally of course. Finished last year as a challenger on main and went 3 for 1. My 5th game of rank at a normal time friday around 9 o'clock had a que time of 45 minutes. On average i have 20 minute que times at normal hours. 3rd issue which is unrelated is the replay system. Why does one need 3rd party programs to watch their games. Simply put O.P riot is incompetent with one of the biggest games in the world. Probs will hurt them in the future in terms of profits.
